comments:
End user ui: I20070929-1800 on top of the 3.4 M3

Once I closed the end user ui, I can't reopen it ever. The only way is to trash the workspace. 

Steps:
- Start eclipse
- Go to the end user ui
- Click on the "available features" tab
- Click "cancel"
- Try to open the end user ui, you will get the following exception


java.lang.NumberFormatException: There is no setting associated with the key "SelectedTab"

I'm not seeing this from a provisioned SDK + UI.
Were you running the end user UI from the agent?  Or from a provisioned UI?

I see it now.  It happens when cancel is the first button you've used.  Since I had previously pressed "OK" the settings were there, and pushing cancel didn't cause a problem.

The fix is simple, just a null check on the dialog settings code.

Longer term fix, now that I'm looking at it, is to get rid of the OK and Cancel buttons, since everything you do in this dialog has effect.  We could either remove the buttons completely, or just have a "Close" button.

Fixed.
Opened bug #208026 for getting rid of OK/Cancel buttons.

traces.message: There is no setting associated with the key "SelectedTab"
